page.title: 01APPLEFORD AND LONG WITTENHAM
page.content: The dominant feature of this area is the low lying alluvial valley of the Thames. On the south bank of the river, on slightly higher, flood free ground lie the two villages, Appleford and {Long Wittenham}. The ground then rises to the SE of the block. This mainly agricultural land is broken up by odd knolls of trees. The soil is fairly good, supporting barley and winter wheat, potatoes and oilseed rape. The meadows alongside the river are used for grazing in the summer. Pigs and some sheep are also kept on higher ground.
